name: Data Fabric
description: An architecture that provides a consistent and unified data management framework across cloud, on-premises, and edge environments using AI to automate data integration.
accuracyNote: Databricks, Snowflake, and dbt are data platforms, not 'data fabric' as Gartner defined it (AI-automated data integration across environments). Most organizations still struggle with basic data integration. The specific 'data fabric' concept hasn't materialized.

name: Cybersecurity Mesh
description: A flexible, modular approach to security that integrates widely distributed security services. Enables best-of-breed security tools to work together.
accuracyNote: Accurate — SASE, XDR, and identity-mesh approaches became the enterprise security norm. Vendors consolidated into platforms while maintaining interoperability.

name: Privacy-Enhancing Computation
description: Three technologies for protecting data while in use: trusted execution environments, privacy-aware ML (federated learning), and homomorphic encryption.
accuracyNote: Progressing but still emerging — confidential computing (Azure, GCP) gained traction. Federated learning is used in specific domains. Full practical deployment remains limited.

name: Cloud-Native Platforms
description: Cloud-native platforms using containers, serverless, and microservices would become the default for building and running elastic, resilient applications.
accuracyNote: Spot on — Kubernetes, serverless (Lambda, Cloud Functions), and container-based development became the default enterprise approach. Cloud-native is now the standard.

name: Composable Applications
description: Applications built from modular, business-centric components (packaged business capabilities) that can be easily composed, recomposed, and extended.
accuracyNote: Directionally correct — API-first, headless architectures, and micro-frontends adopted this philosophy. But most enterprises still build monoliths or semi-modular systems.

name: Decision Intelligence
description: A practical approach that uses AI, analytics, and decision modeling to improve organizational decision-making at all levels.
accuracyNote: 'AI-powered decision support' using 'analytics and decision modeling' is consultant-speak for 'using data to make decisions' — something happening for decades. The specific term 'decision intelligence' didn't catch on.

name: Hyperautomation
description: A disciplined, business-driven approach to rapidly identify, vet, and automate as many business processes as possible.
accuracyNote: Still describing RPA + AI pipelines for process automation. RPA market growth slowed as the approach hit practical limits. The automation that actually worked at scale in 2024-2025 came from LLM agents — a completely different paradigm than the rule-based automation toolchains Gartner kept promoting.

name: AI Engineering
description: A discipline focused on making AI a part of the mainstream software engineering process, including MLOps, model governance, and responsible AI practices.
accuracyNote: Predicted making AI mainstream via 'MLOps and model governance.' Post-ChatGPT, the discipline shifted entirely to prompt engineering, LLM evaluation, and RAG — none of which are traditional MLOps. The field evolved in a completely different direction than described.

name: Distributed Enterprise
description: The shift to remote and hybrid work would reshape enterprise architecture, with organizations optimizing for distributed-first operations.
accuracyNote: Hybrid work was already the norm when this prediction was published. Describing a continuation of post-COVID work patterns is observation, not prediction.

name: Total Experience
description: A strategy that unifies employee experience, customer experience, user experience, and multiexperience to drive greater confidence in the workforce and customers.
accuracyNote: Aspirational — companies talked about unified experience strategies, but execution remains fragmented. Individual experience domains improved more than the unified vision.

name: Autonomic Systems
description: Self-managing physical or software systems that learn from their environments and dynamically modify their own algorithms in real time without software updates.
accuracyNote: Still aspirational — while self-healing infrastructure and auto-scaling improved, truly autonomic systems that self-modify remain mostly in research.

name: Generative AI
description: AI that can learn from existing content and generate new, realistic artifacts including text, images, video, and code that reflect the characteristics of the training data.
accuracyNote: Perhaps the most perfectly timed prediction ever — DALL-E 2, Stable Diffusion, and ChatGPT all launched in 2022, making generative AI the defining technology of the decade.
